brief.content-text:
Enterprise networks need a reliable and scalable routing protocol to maintain communications, and select the best path.

Link-state routing protocols such as OSPF are ideally suited to the needs of enterprise networks.

Network technicians configure and verify OSPF to support basic routing functionality and authentication.

Network engineers configure a hierarchical design for OSPF to access the Internet, and for improved routing efficiency.

After completion of this chapter, you should be able to:
Describe and plan a network using OSPF
Design and configure a network using single-area OSPF
Work with multi-protocol environments
